search_results.snippet: Word History The dachshund is a dog with short legs and a long history. The breed was developed in Germany more than a thousand years ago to hunt burrowing animals such as badgers. ... The German name for the breed was dachshund, a compound of dachs, meaning "badger," and hund, "dog."
